quest.name: The Restaurateur's Guide to the Dragonstar
journal:
Last Dregs management would discuss the further development of your business plan.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

N-7000 and Jammingway are pleased to report that the Miw Miisv seem as happy as giant jellyfish from the sea of stars can possibly be─which is to say, quite. With the aim of experiencing the lively air these young creatures have imparted to the Last Dregs, you agree to accompany your fellow managers on their rounds.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You find the Last Dregs bustling but not overcrowded, leading to the inevitable proposal that you procure yet more patrons. Ever overflowing with ideas, Jammingway asserts that the dragons would be prime candidates. Though N-7000 expresses strong reservations given its civilization's role in the Dragonstar's untimely end, it is eventually convinced to make contact in the name of a better future for all involved.

You proceed to Reah Tahra, where Jammingway attempts to hail a representative of the Dragonstar. Though they do eventually succeed in this first step, it quickly becomes clear that your allied units will struggle to generate interest in the Last Dregs─or any feeling at all─due to the dragons' utter emotional exhaustion from having spent eons in mourning. Upon discussion, it is agreed that a dragon of more agreeable disposition might provide ideas on raising her kin from their dead-eyed torpor, so you make ready to return to Etheirys and consult with wise Vidofnir.

Though she is aware of her people's history with the invaders from the Alphatron Star, Vidofnir elects to concern herself with the welfare of her fellow dragons rather than ancient grudges. She explains to your party that the sacred peaks of the Dragonstar once evoked such bittersweet nostalgia in Midgardsormr that he chose his brood's new home by the look of its mountains─the peak now known as Sohm Al first among them─and suggests you attempt to stir her lost kin's memories of the same. Fortunately, there is a Coerthan dessert that may do just that.

Armed with the knowledge of which terrestrial resources once brought a nostalgic tear to Midgardsormr's eye, you gather the perfect ingredients near Anyx Trine, and set about making a confectioner's Sohm Al. Though your guest from Reah Tahra is reluctant at first, the sight of the dessert recalls memories of the Dragonstar's mountains that resonate to his very core, filling him with wistful fondness. Indeed, he soon wishes to bring other dragons to the Last Dregs for a similar experience, and reassures N-7000 that this will not mean the resuming of hostilities─for what is past is long, long past.

Alongside your allies, you venture to Elysion, a portion of which has now been transformed into a vision of the Dragonstar. Peaks tower over a clutch of eggs, and hope that dragons may soon coast upon the breeze reigns. Apparently more affected by N-7000's previous statements than they let on, Jammingway takes this success as an opportunity to remind the unit of its life's worth, and its power to bring about change─scientific limitations be damned.
objectives: Speak with Vidofnir at Anyx Trine.
Mine [Error] southwest of Anyx TrineDeliver [Error] to N-7000Gather [Error] northeast of Anyx TrineCatch [Error] at the Iron Feast.
Speak with N-7000 in A-4 Research.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Miw Miisv status: thriving. According to recent scans, the Ea also emit pleased vibrations.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: They aren't the only ones! Members of quite a few civilizations have been enjoying watching the Miw Miisv frolic, and customer satisfaction has risen accordingly.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: On that note─it is just about time for our regular rounds at the café. Care to join?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Travel to the Last Dregs?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Café status: bustling. Installation of additional seating recommended.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: As you can see, the Last Dregs is now patronized by entities of all ages─and we have expanded our beverage range to accommodate both the young and the very, very old accordingly.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Now that the Miw Miisv and the Ea have settled in, the timing to introduce new patrons is optimal.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, I was just thinking the same!

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: We've had such good luck with the Ea, it only seems natural that we invite the dragons next. They too are residents of Ultima Thule, after all.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Shall this unit scan your cranial cavern for irregularities? We Omicrons are the dragons' mortal enemies─they would not willingly break bread or any other substance with us. Projections indicate they may be traumatized by the very suggestion.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Are you worried about them? How endearing!

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Yet if Ultima Thule is to move forward, its people cannot remain mired in the conflicts of the past. It would befoul the dynamis, for one thing, and bugger up our hard work. You must learn to live in harmony!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Acknowledged...but this unit will excuse itself from promotional efforts. The probability of the Dragonstar's life-forms reacting adversely to Omicron presence in their territory exceeds acceptable parameters.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Parameters, shmarameters. It may be risky, but if the dragons are to believe that the Omicrons have turned over a new leaf, I can think of no better ambassador.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: You may not be able to rewind time and un-conquer the Dragonstar, but you can certainly strive to do better in the future we're creating. Dynamis makes the impossible possible─you said so yourself!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: ...Encouragement tentatively internalized. This unit will attempt to serve as an ambassador for peace.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Then it is off to Reah Tahra we go!

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Good perpetual evening, good sir, madam, or other! Can I interest you in a hot cup of coffee?

dialogue.name: NIBIRAENOMI
dialogue.text: The mournful dirge that echoes through this place is pleasing to the ear. Why do some of these individuals still rage against their fate?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit has detected an additional hurdle to fulfilling the current objective.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Excuse me! Can I interest you in, er...anything? Anything at all!?

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Hello!? Ignoring me won't make me go away!

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: ...I wondered how a tuft of floss did come to clamor so, but 'tis no more than one of thy strange companions. This explaineth much.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Wilt thou not leave me to my slumber? So long have I been weary...

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: We have just the thing for that─coffee! Delectable cuisine, as well. Why not stop by the Last Dregs and see what the civilizations of Ultima Thule are raving about?

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: I realize that you may have complicated feelings about my Omicron friend here, but we would nevertheless offer you a place to eat, drink, and be merry!

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Art thou attempting to provoke me...? Though I suppose it matters not.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Neither grief nor hate stir within me, for my flame hath long since flickered and died.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> The news that you do not wish to inflict vengeful obliteration upon the Alphatron Star should be welcome. However, this unit finds it unexpectedly difficult to process.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Are you certain you do not desire revenge? Not even a micron? It may be advisable to gnaw on this unit in the name of experimentation, lest your conclusion be premature.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: To what end? The destruction of a single machine changeth naught─meaneth naught.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Aye, we dragons once reveled as thou wouldst have me do. In the mountain's shadow did we gather to sing. Yet even our melodies are naught but memory now...

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: If I no longer weep for the silence, machine, why dost thou believe I have aught to spare for thee?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Conversational difficulty levels critical. This unit requests permission to retreat.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Not so fast! The Karellians' apocalyptic aggression didn't stop us, and neither will this dragon's depression.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: All of our patrons have needed a little help in learning to hope again. It's just a matter of discerning what they value and how to provide it.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Fortunately, we have the great Forename at our side! I've heard tell that you have no little experience treating with dragons.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: And though the dragons here may not recall their passions, if the Dragonsong War is any indication, their brethren on Etheirys possess no such problem.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Surely there is at least one dragon of your acquaintance with whom we can consult?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Vrtra will explain in terms we can understand.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Vidofnir is wise, and has been kind to me.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Vrtra!? Satrap of Radz-at-Han? Oh, no, I wouldn't dream of calling him away from his work for this.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Vidofnir it is, then. As a leader of her people and an arbiter of peace, she must have some advice about disagreeable dragons.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: And she doesn't sound like the sort to let her elders on the Dragonstar wallow for eternity.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Etheirys's historical records are not registered to this unit's database, but the proposed course sounds logical as described.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: It is statistically probable that they will not welcome assistance from a former enemy...but this unit believes that we must restore hope to dragonkind.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Then it's decided. Do we need to pack chassis wax or anything?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit must remain in Ultima Thule to ensure the smooth operation of the Last Dregs while allied life-forms are away. However, a portable communications drone can be dispatched for the journey.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: How convenient! Let us make for Anyx Trine posthaste!

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Would that I could recall the feel of the mountain breeze...but even that lieth beyond my power now.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Communications network fully operational. This unit will ensure that customer experience remains optimal in your absence, and wishes you a pleasant traversal of space.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Dost thou ever rest, Little One? Thou hast brought salvation to the star, yet thy countenance bespeaks a mission.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: The will of the star hath blessed thee with charming companions.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Yet to think I should meet one of the “machines” that drove my grandsire from the Dragonstar... 'Tis like unto a bedtime fable.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Fear not, for I shall not rebuke thee. Thou wouldst not be the first to call an old foe “friend”...

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: 'Tis the fate of the dragons that concerneth me. To condemn them to an empty existence forevermore would be cruel indeed.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit did not expect to find you so...pleasant? Alive? It is difficult to locate the proper lexical data.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Jammingway shared much data about the dragons of Etheirys during the journey, but this unit struggles to process that those who embrace an ageless existence upon this star are of the same species as the life-forms we encountered in Ultima Thule.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Your dragons too faced countless battles and great suffering, yet they emerged whole. This unit wonders how much can be attributed to faith in their allied units, and how much to the resilience of their hope─or if these two variables are one and the same.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: ...Which brings us back to our purpose here. Is there anything we can say to the dragons of Ultima Thule that might open their hearts to embrace hope once more?

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: My sire, Hraesvelgr, oft spoke of Midgardsormr's tales of the Dragonstar, for from these memories was our Sohm Al born.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: 'Tis mine understanding that the Dragonstar possessed a sacred peak resplendent, and 'twas my grandsire's longing for its heights that drew him to nest upon Etheirys.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Mine ancestors doubtless felt its loss as keenly, yet their despair hath given way to exhaustion. The memory 'tis but a dull ache in their hearts.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Restore to them memory untainted by bitterness, and they may yet be inspired as my grandsire once was. Words, however, shall not suffice.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: If not words, what about taste? We've managed to evoke joyful recollections via soup before─surely we can do the same for the dragons.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Previous customer data supports this hypothesis.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: However, dragons do not possess a culinary tradition as such. As with the Grebuloffs, we must think outside standard parameters.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, I believe I have precisely what we need.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Among the recipes provided to us by our Sharlayan collaborators is one from Ishgard─a dessert resembling Sohm Al! If that's not outside standard parameters, I don't know what is.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: A curious proposal, but thou art welcome to attempt it.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Southwest of Anyx Trine lie lustrous minerals, their sheen not unlike those of the Dragonstar's peaks. Collect them with my blessing.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: My grandsire once spoke of the pale blossoms northeast of Anyx Trine as like unto those of the Dragonstar's valleys. Collect them with my blessing.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: My grandsire once spoke of an iridescent fish in the Iron Feast, its scales a shade identical to the Dragonstar's holy peak.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Collect one with my blessing─I am told they subsist upon roe.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit reminds you that all proceeds from gold salmon roe─available perpetually in A-4 Research─will be directed toward Omicron enhancement initiatives.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: It sounds like we shall be gazing upon a resplendent─and edible─peak in no time!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit requests that you return to the Last Dregs before initiating baking protocols. The utility of this drone's tiny digits is limited.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Thou art truly a warrior of warriors, yet much else besides...

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: We do strive to make our dishes visually appealing, but this will be our greatest challenge yet! I do hope the dragons appreciate it...

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Drone battery low. This unit has returned it to the charging station despite Jammingway's protests.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Ingredients consistent with Dragonstar environmental records. Please initiate baking protocols.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Consider them initiated. Dessert is go!

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Remember, machine─'tis only at the purported request of my kin across the expanse that I humor thee. Do not test my patience overlong.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: We wouldn't dream of it! Now, if you'll come this way...

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: ...Thy tiny hands wrought this for my sake?

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Yes! Forename's less-tiny hands and N-7000's spinny whatsits also helped. We worked hard to make it as much like the holy peak of the Dragonstar as possible.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Do you... Do you like it?

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: ...'Tis difficult to say. My palate recalleth not what flavors once appealed. Visually, however...

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: I see it. The peaks dividing the Dragonstar in twain, bright clouds to shroud them...

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: I feel the wind upon my scales, and I...remember.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: A passing strange place, this... Yet for the newfound bond with my distant kin, and these memories gifted unto me, I am grateful.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: The gesture hath touched me─of that, be certain.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Do you feel a bit better now?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: It's all right to miss home. Everyone does, sometimes.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Indeed. How beautiful it was, our Dragonstar. How joyfully its winds did brace our wings...

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: I should like my kin to remember those days. No longer to mourn them, but dream of them once more...

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: This unit is pleased to hear of your spiritual revival.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: However, it would be remiss of this unit not to remind you that our establishment employs a large Omicron staff. Your kin would be most welcome to join you, but would this not be intolerable to them?

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: Metal warrior... Thou art not the same as thou once were. No more are we. I know not what to make of this future, but I would linger no longer in the past.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: That is why you created this place, is it not?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Logic circuits: complete. Threat level: nominal. Business status: booming.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: However, this unit is experiencing an anomalous overflow. Conditions mathematically insufficient to generate current levels of mission satisfaction. Further analysis required. Initializing additional processors...

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Are you sure you aren't just...happy? You know, like a squishy-wishy organic life-form?

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: An illogical life-form such as yourself could not begin to understand this unit's internal workings. Terminating interaction─good-bye.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Don't you dare go into sleep mode! Coward!

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: We cannot let N-7000's emotional disfunction detract from our success. To Elysion! We'll drag it there if we must.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Travel to A-4 Research?

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: I'm happy, you're happy, the dragon is happy... There's nothing anomalous about being happy!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Please refrain from vibrating your vocal organs. This unit will continue processing anomalous satisfaction levels once Elysion status has been verified.

dialogue.name: DRAGONOMI
dialogue.text: I do hope that winds bless yonder peak...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Inspiration has touched the dragons' hearts, and given form to a nostalgic vista from the Dragonstar.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Yet still there is room for Elysion to grow and change! What other hopes will the power of dynamis bring to life?

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: What a majestic sight that was. And so pointy!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: <whirr> Harmony between dragons and Omicrons defies any and all prior projections.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: A rousing success, then!

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: Given historical events, it should not be possible per the laws of the universe. Only in Ultima Thule could such a thing occur.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: In that case, I'd better not hear you question our potential ever again! This is definitive proof that we can do anything if we put our minds to it, no matter what your projections say.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: I was created by someone too, you know? But I don't believe that being artificial makes our experiences any less worthwhile. We're here, and we're making a difference! Have a little faith─that's what living is all about.

dialogue.name: N7000
dialogue.text: ...This unit did not realize that you were plagued by similar existential doubts, though it does explain your desire to pry into psyches you do not understand. Nevertheless, this unit will produce noises of generalized validation.

dialogue.name: JAMMINGWAY
dialogue.text: Well...good! We've created a miracle here today─as well as new bonds between dragonkind that span time and space. I propose we bask in that glory for a while!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Honored reputation with the staff and patrons of the Last Dregs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Omicron tribal daily quests are now available from Stigma-4 at A-4 Research.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from Stigma-4 as a reputation bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for tribal quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from Stigma-4. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you now have access to a wider selection of wares from Omicron N-0598.
